DataElement.preferredName: Patient Future Research Cancer Biobank Storage Consent Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator for information related to a patient's consent to provide specimen(s) for future research and storage in a Biobank.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Future Research Cancer Biobank Storage Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to a patient's consent to provide specimen(s) for future research and storage in a Biobank.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Future Research Cancer Biobank Storage Consent
Property.preferredDefinition: A time that is yet to come.:systematic investigation to establish facts.:A repository of biospecimens - including tissue samples, fluids such as blood, serum and urine, and molecular derivatives such as DNA, RNA and proteins pertaining to cancer research. The repository has stringent guidelines regarding the standardized collection, handling, storage and documentation of biological specimens. These guidelines enable an extensive system for specimen storage that allows for the accurate establishment of disease incidences over long periods of time.:The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A time that is yet to come.

A repository of biospecimens - including tissue samples, fluids such as blood, serum and urine, and molecular derivatives such as DNA, RNA and proteins pertaining to cancer research. The repository has stringent guidelines regarding the standardized collection, handling, storage and documentation of biological specimens. These guidelines enable an extensive system for specimen storage that allows for the accurate establishment of disease incidences over long periods of time.
The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient has agreed that his/h
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has agreed that his/her sample(s) and related information may be kept in a Biobank for use in future health research.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient agree to be in the Biobanking part of the study and have leftover tumor tissue and some normal blood, bone marrow, or other tissue saved for future research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did parent/guardian agree to be in the Biobanking DNA part of the study to have their DNA saved for future research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alt 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: My samples and related information may be kept in a Biobank for use in future health research.

ReferenceDocuments.description: My samples and related information may be kept in a Biobank for use in future health research?

ReferenceDocuments.description: The participant agreed that his/her samples and related information may be kept in a Biobank for use in future laboratory studies and health research

ReferenceDocuments.description: My non-biopsy samples such as leftover blood samples and related information may be kept in a Biobank for use in future health research.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant has given permission for blood samples and related information to be kept in a Biobank for use in future health research.

ReferenceDocuments.description: The participant agrees that his/her samples and related information may be kept in a NCI Biobank for use in future health research.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has consented for the biobanking of left-over samples and the use of these samples for future research, including genetic testing.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient agreed to have five (5) blood samples collected and stored at the NRG Oncology Serum Bank for use in future health research related to the purposes of this study?
